activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Cotton, Sir J

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF113, 22CF128, 22CF114, 22CM123 called at 9:27am[Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]

Defendant Sir J Cotton not in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman appeared by zoom for Sir J Cotton.  
Defendant Ryan J Griffin not in court. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appeared in court for Ryan J Griffin. 
Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty De La Rosa confirms Mr. Griffin remains in out of state custody. 
Atty Jochman indicates that he cannot explain Mr. Cotton's non-appearance, recently spoke with him regarding new offer. 

The Court and Counsel discuss IAD (Interstate Agreement on Detainers) procedures and Mr. Griffin's current custody status in New Mexico and/or Colorado. 

Upon inquiry of the the Court, ADA Beck indicates that the State cannot get Mr. Griffin here within 10 days as demanded for speedy preliminary hearing. 

The Court dismisses Mr. Griffin's cases without prejudice.  

Atty Jochman gives case update as to Mr. Cotton's cases. 

ADA Beck requests a warrant be authorized and stayed for Mr. Cotton. 

The Court authorizes and stays warrant until next scheduled date for Mr. Cotton.
recess: 9:39am 
NEXT: As to Mr. Cotton's Cases, 22CF113 & 22CF128: Status on 11/14/22 at 8:30am via zoom

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #22CF113, #22CF128, #22CF114, #22CM123 called at 3:30pm
Co-Defendant Sir J Cotton appears. Attorney Tyler A Jochman appears. 
CO-Defendant Ryan J. Griffin does not appear. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears. 
ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court summary of information the Court has received that Mr. Griffin is now in the La Plata County Jail in Durango, Colorado, and that there are detainers on Mr. Griffin from multiple states.  
ADA Witt indicates his office has noted that, as to the interstate detainers issue, it appears there is no available legal mechanism to get Mr. Griffin here at this point.  

Arraignment is held in Case #22CF113, #22CF128-Cotton: 
--Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial
recess 3:43pm 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference in Cases #22CF113 and #22CF128 (Cotton) only on August 24th at 11:400am--only counsel need to appear,  (2) Status Conference on September 2nd at 9:00am with Zoom appearances
Arraignment on August 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #22CF113, #22CF128, #22CF114, #22CM123 called at 9:32am 
Co-Defendant Sir J Cotton appears by audio-only. Attorney Tyler A Jochman appears in court and on Zoom.  
Co-Defendant Ryan J. Griffin does not appear [see below, 9:41am arrival]. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears on Zoom. 
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin in court and on Zoom.
_______________
In Cases #22CF113 and #22CF128 (Co-Defendant Cotton): 
--Mr. Cotton waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts the waiver and binds him over for Trials.
--the Court will schedule arraignments on a later date when Mr. Cotton can find a way to appear by Zoom video and audio.  The Court discusses with Mr. Cotton that if he cannot find such a device or someone with a device to allow him to appear by Zoom video and audio, then he will need to travel to Wisconsin to attend court hearings in person. 
_______________
9:41am. Co-Defendant Ryan Griffin [Cases #22CF114, #22CM123] now appears by video and audio from the Lea, New Mexico Correctional Facility, in custody 
--Mr. Griffin makes statements about not seeing certain participants who are displayed as non-video participants on the Zoom Conference. He wants to be transported for the hearing. Mr. Griffin holds up handwritten signs with comments regarding the Co-Defendant.  
--the Court notes the letter submitted by Attorney De La Rosa which indicates that Mr. Griffin is not waiving his personal appearance.  Attorney De La Rosa provides information that Mr. Griffin is expected to be incarcerated in New Mexico for the next 4-5 years 
--ADA Beck requests issuance of warrants which would cause Mr. Griffin to be transported here after his custodial status ends in New Mexico, however the Court denies the request at this point. Instead the Court adjourns to allow time for the State to determine how it will proceed.  
--as to Case #22CM123:  the Court grants the State's request to re-designate the case number back to a felony case number now that the State is filing an Amended Criminal Complaint that charges a felony.  The Court directs that the clerk is to assign the case number that had been originally assigned case, #22CF129, if possible.   
recess 9:54am 

NEXT: (1) Mr. Griffin's case #22CM123 is to be renumbered to a felony case number, if possible case #22CF129,   (2) Arraignment in Cases #22CF113 and #22CF128, and Status Conference in Cases #22CF114 and the new case number--- all on on August 4th at 3:30pm  JA note in case #22CF114 comments that case is at prelim stage;  this hearing is to be scheduled with the appearances-format that both Defendants will appear by Zoom Conference
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF114 & 22CM123 called at 9:30am  {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Ryan J Griffin appears by phone through zoom from Lea County(New Mexico) Correctional Facility, in custody. Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears.   Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon inquiry of the Court, parties agree they are not comfortable with proceeding with preliminary hearing via audio means only. 

The Court calls 22CF113 & 22CF128(Cotton) at 9:37am
Attorney Tyler A Jochman appears via zoom. Defendant Sir Cotton does NOT appear.

Mr. Griffin asserts that the facility should be able to accomodate a video appearance. 

The Court adjourns preliminary hearing.

On State's Motion to Amend Criminal Complaint in Case 22CM123:
--no objection from Atty De La Rosa
--maximum penalities and charges recited

The Court defers entry of pleas and speedy trial demand until next date, to allow Atty De La Rosa to confer with Mr. Griffin. 

Cases  22CF114, 22CF113,22CF128 were scheduled for preliminary hearing; officer-witness is present via zoom.

recess: 9:48am 
NEXT: As to Cases 22CF114, 22CF113,22CF128: Preliminary Hearing on 7/1/22 at 9:30am via zoom
As to Case 22CM123: Status on 7/1/22 at 9:30am via zoom (address pleas and speedy trial)
Motion to Adjourn
to Amend Criminal Complaint
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

**to cover both 22CF113 and 22CF128**
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant Ryan Griffin outside the presence of counsel

[ae] 22CF113 and 22CF128 case called 08:36 AM Defendant Sir J Cotton appeared by telephone. Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $3,000  Signature Bond to cover both 22CF113 and 22CF128, with conditions:
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant Ryan Griffin outside the presence of counsel

Attorney Jochman is to make arrangements with PD in New Mexico to have bond signed. He is to notify COC of the fax information, Defendant is to sign bond by 5/20/22

recess 8:48 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/8/22 at 10 am    (2) Preliminary Hearing on 6/17/22 9:30 am
Attorney Jochman
Tyler Jochman
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received phone call from Defendant post hearing time, Defendant indicated that address is 'Road' instead of 'Street' (will be added as an OT until confirmed in court or in writing from Defendant; additionally Defendant inquired about appearing remotely for next hearing, I instructed him to submit the request is writing and to reach out to SPD office re: appointment of counsel//ma

[ae] cases 22CF113 and 22CF128 08:49 AM Defendant Sir J Cotton not in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court adjourns todays hearing to allow time to verify if Defendant is in custody
recess: 8:52 am
NEXT: IA 5/2/22 at 8:30 am
